intro: Ceropegia papillata var. cordiloba, commonly known as the woolly ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, pale greenish-white flowers. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine, woolly coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. This species is popular among succulent enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
